title: How to Show Hidden Files in Windows 7

steps.title: Click on the Windows 7 Start button.
steps.content: Click on the Windows 7 Start button.

steps.title: Click on Control Panel.
steps.content: Click on Control Panel. You can also click the Start button and then type “folder options” in the search box. Select “Folder Options” in Control Panel from the resulting list.

steps.title: Click on “Appearance and Personalization.
steps.content: Click on “Appearance and Personalization. ”

steps.title: Click “Folder Options.
steps.content: Click “Folder Options. ”

steps.title: Click on the View tab in the Folder Options window.
steps.content: Click on the View tab in the Folder Options window.

steps.title: Click “Show hidden files, folders, and drives” in “Advanced settings” and click “OK.
steps.content: Click “Show hidden files, folders, and drives” in “Advanced settings” and click “OK. ”

steps.title: Choose the “Show hidden files, folders, and drives” radio button in the “Hidden files and folders” category.
steps.content: Choose the “Show hidden files, folders, and drives” radio button in the “Hidden files and folders” category.

steps.title: Click “OK” at the bottom of the Folder Options window.
steps.content: Click “OK” at the bottom of the Folder Options window.

steps.title: Close the Control Panel window.
steps.content: Close the Control Panel window. You should now be able to view all files and folders as well as drives hidden in Windows 7.

steps.title: Test this by navigating to the C:\ drive
steps.content: Test this by navigating to the C : \ drive . Look for a program named “ProgramData.” If you can see this, you are now able to view hidden files and folders.

steps.title: Notice that the icons for hidden files and folders are grayed out.
steps.content: Notice that the icons for hidden files and folders are grayed out. This is how you can differentiate between hidden and unhidden files.

steps.title: Click on the Windows 7 Start button.
steps.content: Click on the Windows 7 Start button.

steps.title: Click on Control Panel.
steps.content: Click on Control Panel.

steps.title: Click on “Appearance and Personalization.
steps.content: Click on “Appearance and Personalization. ”

steps.title: Click “Folder Options.
steps.content: Click “Folder Options. ”

steps.title: Click “View.
steps.content: Click “View. ”

steps.title: Click “Show hidden files, folders, and drives” in “Advanced settings” and click “OK.
steps.content: Click “Show hidden files, folders, and drives” in “Advanced settings” and click “OK. ”

steps.title: Click “Apply.
steps.content: Click “Apply. ”

steps.title: Uncheck the “Hide protected operating system files” box.
steps.content: Uncheck the “Hide protected operating system files” box.

steps.title: See a dialog box asking if you are sure that you want to do this.
steps.content: See a dialog box asking if you are sure that you want to do this.

steps.title: Click “Yes.
steps.content: Click “Yes. ”

steps.title: Click “OK.
steps.content: Click “OK. ”

steps.title: Click the Start button.
steps.content: Click the Start button.

steps.title: Type “regedit” in the search box and press enter.
steps.content: Type “regedit” in the search box and press enter. You must be logged in as an administrator to be able to do these steps.

steps.title: Click “Yes” if prompted to confirm you are an administrator.
steps.content: Click “Yes” if prompted to confirm you are an administrator.

steps.title: Find this key In regedit: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Advanced
steps.content: Find this key In regedit : HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Advanced .

steps.title: Go to the right side of the Advanced window, where the values can be seen.
steps.content: Go to the right side of the Advanced window, where the values can be seen.

steps.title: Find the value “Hidden.
steps.content: Find the value “Hidden. ”

steps.title: Right click it and change it to 1.
steps.content: Right click it and change it to 1.

steps.title: Click the Start button.
steps.content: Click the Start button.

steps.title: Type “regedit” in the search box and press enter.
steps.content: Type “regedit” in the search box and press enter.

steps.title: Click “Yes” if prompted to confirm you are an administrator.
steps.content: Click “Yes” if prompted to confirm you are an administrator.

steps.title: Find this key In regedit: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Advanced
steps.content: Find this key In regedit : HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Advanced .

steps.title: Go to the right side of the Advanced window, where the values are seen.
steps.content: Go to the right side of the Advanced window, where the values are seen.

steps.title: Right click on “Super Hidden ” and click on Modify.
steps.content: Right click on “Super Hidden ” and click on Modify.

steps.title: Type 1.
steps.content: Type 1.

steps.title: Click “OK.
steps.content: Click “OK. ”
